author: Tribune Web Desk
title: Virat Kohli's lean patch continues with back-to-back ducks against Australia - The Tribune
text:
Virat Kohli's lean patch continues with back-to-back ducks against Australia
The spotlight was once again on Virat Kohli, but for all the wrong reasons. The Indian batting great’s lean patch stretched further on Thursday as he fell for a second straight duck in the ODI series against Australia in Adelaide — a rare slump for one of modern cricket’s most consistent performers.
Walking in during the seventh over after captain Shubman Gill’s dismissal, Kohli looked determined to rebuild India’s innings. However, his stay was short-lived.
After carefully negotiating the first three deliveries from Xavier Bartlett, Kohli was undone by a sharp inswinger that crashed into his stumps. Without a second thought, he walked back to the pavilion — a sight that left fans stunned and social media abuzz.
This marked Kohli’s second consecutive duck, raising questions about his rhythm and shot selection in recent outings.
Known for his unmatched intensity and hunger for runs, the 35-year-old has endured a few starts and stops over the past year, and his current form will be a talking point as India continues its preparations for upcoming tournaments.
At the toss earlier, Australia captain Mitchell Marsh elected to bowl first against India in the second ODI. India are unchanged, while Australia made two changes, bringing in Alex Carey for Josh Philippe and Xavier Bartlett in place of Nathan Ellis.
